reviews.body: We've had it for a few days and so far this is a great phone with an awesome screen and features, runs fast, looks nice, works with our network and you can't beat the price. The phone is completely worth it the only thing I'm not completely in love with is the camera, is not bad it takes pretty good pictures but previously owned a zte axon 7 and the quality is lower on the Huawei Y9 which we don't mind honestly since this Huawei is not as expensive as the axon it is expected. But for the price is definitely a must buy we were weary of buying it because we saw a couple reviews and answers saying it might only take 2g or 3g but it received a 4g signal and everything works smoothly, we are currently using Cricket Wireless as our service provider. We had only purchased one phone to check if we like it and if it worked with Cricket and now we're ready to make another purchase because we loved it.

reviews.name: Daniel Margosis
reviews.body: This phone is exactly what I was looking for; A very large, bright screen, loud speaker (wish it had stereo speakers, but hey, no complaints here) and even with 3 gigs of RAM, it's still fast with the Kirin 710 processor. Also cames with Android Oreo out of the box. The Huawei cloud services that they offer isn't available in the US, but no big deal when Google keeps everything on their cloud. I did use the help app to ask some questions about settings and got answers back within in a few hours from Huawei's help team. Overall, a great phone at a great price. BUY IT!

The phone is fast and snappy though ram management is aggressive and you will be reloading apps. The battery life is phenomenal, lasts 2 days sometimes. People tell me at times they call me but I did not receive call, if it wasn't for that I would give 5 stars.

But for the features and performance at a little over $200, this "beats the brakes off" a phone that cost $600 more.

reviews.body: Absolutely, worth buying. Phone has a smooth processor at that and runs very smoothly. It even has 64GB in internal storage who can beat that, and it's Dual Sim Card along with ability to take moving pictures. An option not available on the Huawei Y7 2019. I absolutely prefer the Huawei Y9 2019 over the Huawei Y7 2019. Your videos show clear as daylight, I'm able to stream videos at 1020p now! I wasn't able to on the Huawei Y7 2019, now I can 😁. I'm definitely glad I made the switch. I totally give this phone a rating of 5 stars. The processor and overall performance of this phone up there with phones that range between $500-$800. Definitely recommended individuals to purchase this beautiful device. Sidenote: I bought my Huawei Y9 2019 in the condition of Used Like New and boy this phone has no issues whatsoever or blemishes.

description: The next generation Samsung Galaxy S10+ is as powerful, intelligent and intuitive as you are, providing endless possibilities and next- level power in performance, productivity, creation and design. Known as the Da Vinci of smartphones, the Galaxy S10 features pro lenses to capture stunning photos and the S-Pen to easily create content and utilize your smartphone’s full capabilities. Get more from your S10 with all new creative features such as Single Take AI, Pro Video, and more. Advanced low light technology in the pro lenses gives you the ability to shoot with long exposure-style captures so your content features striking light trails.  Capture video and multiple types of images with one tap of the shutter button and then easily and quickly share more, quicker. The Galaxy S10+ features a powerful processor, intelligent power and a long-lasting battery that learns your habits and adapts to your screen usage in order to optimize power and performance. With Unlocked by Samsung, you get to choose the carrier, data plan, services, features and apps you want.

High-quality camera lenses: With a full set of pro lenses, including ultrawide for stunning landscapes and micro-zoom for epic details, Galaxy S10+ is a studio in your pocket, featuring live video bokeh, precision audio focus and super-stabilization
Photos and video with one tap: capture multiple images and video all at once, in one tap. Lenses, effects and filters capture the best of every moment, every time
Capture with pro-grade tool set made for masters: Control your camera settings with Pro-Video Mode to adjust the exposure, focus and more to bring your creative vision to life
Share more, quicker: The Galaxy S10+ can now connect to and share with up to 5 other compatible devices at the same time using Bluetooth and WiFi, with no limits on content type or file size

Sleek Design: Samsung Galaxy S10+ boasts a super-slim design that fits comfortably in your pocket and easily sits in the hand. A 6.4” endless quad HD+ dynamic AMOLED screen with nearly bezel-less infinity display offers a cinematic viewing experience

All-day Battery: Fast-charging, long-lasting intelligent power features super-speed processing, Wireless PowerShare, and massive storage, and tailors battery usage to how you live and work to optimize battery life to last all day

title_item: (Refurbished) Apple iPhone XR, US Version, 64GB, Black - Unlocked
description: With the iPhone XR you get a roomy 6.1-inch display, fast enough performance from Apple's A12 Bionic processor and good camera quality in a colorful design and affordable package. Apple has included the all-new Liquid Retina LCD as the display on the iPhone XR. Apple released the iPhone XR with a smattering of color options. Both the glass back and the metal frame are brightly colored, with the glass using an in-depth seven-layer color process to achieve the rich finish and the Apple-exclusive aluminum alloy anodized to match. Instead of 3D Touch, the iPhone XR replicates the experience through "Haptic Touch". Advanced Face ID lets you securely unlock your iPhone and log in to apps with just a glance.

Inspected and guaranteed to have minimal cosmetic damage, which is not noticeable when the device is held at arm's length.

reviews.name: M. Marshall
reviews.title_review: Chipped and locked; not as described
reviews.body: This review isn’t about the type of phone. This is about the phone I received front the seller. The item was described as unlocked and like new. It was neither. There was a small chip in the bottom corner, and it was locked with T-Mobile. Obviously I have no choice but to return the item.

reviews.name: Some Bozemanite
reviews.body: "Renewed products work and look like new." Except this one has visible scratches on the screen. As a bonus, it's the Pixel 3a "XL" and not the phone I ordered.

reviews.name: Marcia Carter
reviews.body: Everything about this phone is great, however it is locked with verizon even though the description says otherwise. Verizon said they have no way of unlocking the phone. Money was wasted on screen protectors, cover, and even a non reimbursable phone transfer fee from my carrier since I didn't know it was locked until they did their thing. Very upset at the financial loss due to mis-advertising considering the times we live in have been harsh on me.

reviews.name: Gabriel
reviews.title_review: Amazon Renewed Guarantee means nothing. Sellers use the terms and policies they want.
reviews.body: I bought this phone thinking Amazon Renewed Guarantee was reliable, turns out I was mistaken. The phone came locked with Verizon even though it is advertised as unlocked. This is not a minor flaw; it makes the phone completely useless to me. It is also something extremely easy to check beforehand so ¿Why is the seller so careless? Also, could not get a replacement because the seller (GM Deals) did not want to apply the Amazon Renewed Guarantee terms under which the item was sold (this is a scam). This seller benefits from the increase of sales from the Amazon Renewed Guarantee tag, but does not accept the responsibility and terms it comes with. I would avoid buying if it comes from GM Deals. Amazon should enforce the Amazon Renewed Guarantee terms when giving this tag to third-party sellers. Edit: After almost a month I got a full refund. I will slightly increase rating solely on the customer support given by Giancarlo G. which was great, very helpful and polite. But the seller did not want to cooperate.

reviews.name: James Hall
reviews.body: The phone was not unlocked or factory reset. I received the previous owner's SIM card with it. WTF? How do you not check for these things? The only upsides are that the phone arrived in good condition and that shipping was faster than expected. I'll be getting a replacement from this seller to see if their second attempt is better. Update: Second phone seems fine, so I'm bumping this up one star.

reviews.name: Jb30777
reviews.body: Bought this phone because my iphone 6 got wet and stopped working. But even before it got wet it was starting to glitch a lot and heat up all the time which led to an even shorter battery life. I have now had this pixel 3a for just over a year and I have never had any problems with it. No glitching, long battery life that lasts all day as long as I'm not watching a bunch of videos, it takes great pictures day and night. The resolution is not as good as the newer iphones but it's still above satisfactory. All around a great phone especially if you don't want to spend $900+ on a good smart phone.

about: This phone is unlocked and compatible with any carrier of choice on GSM and CDMA networks (e.g. AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Verizon, US Cellular, Cricket, Metro, Tracfone, Mint Mobile, etc.).

reviews.body: Estoy extremadamente satisfecho con esta compra. La estética del teléfono es de 10, la capacidad máxima de la batería indica 100% y hasta ahora su funcionamiento es excelente. El teléfono llegó sin la caja y cargador originales pero aún así le doy una calificación excelente. Definitivamente recomiendo a este vendedor.

reviews.name: JuanV
reviews.title_review: Pantalla rayada con mica para cubrirlo
reviews.body: Ya tenía experiencia con los productos renewed pero este teléfono no cumplió con las expectativas, la pantalla venía rayada, le instalaron una mica de vidrio para cubrir los rayones y tenía pegamento alrededor de la pantalla. Me enviaron una nueva unidad igual llegó con la pantalla rayada, una mica de cristal para tapar los rayones, además de tener algo raro en el vidrio de las cámaras. Espero más adelante tengan teléfonos de otro vendedor.

reviews.name: Judith Kim
reviews.body: Had some problems with the phone, First off; the screen protector was cracked when received - I was shocked and thought the screen itself was broken but I think its only the protector thats cracked. Second off; the phone did not register to the service provider for a bit I had to call them to "activate" the phone to get it to turn on LTE and stuff otherwise its ok.

title_item: Motorola Moto E6 Play XT2029-1 32GB Unlocked GSM Dual SIM Phone w/ 13MP Camera - Ocean Blue
description: With a fingerprint reader and face unlock, the moto e6 play gets you right to your favorite apps and entertainment without any passwords. Plus, you’ll enjoy tons of storage and a wide 5.5" HD+ display. With two fast and easy ways to unlock your phone, passwords are a thing of the past. Just touch the fingerprint reader located discreetly beneath the iconic batwing logo. Or unlock with a simple glance into the selfie camera. With 32 GB of built-in storage*, you have plenty of room for photos, songs, and movies. If you need extra space, you can always add up to 256 GB** more using the dedicated microSD card slot. Bring your favorite movies, games and websites to life on a wide screen. With a 5.5" screen, and an 18:9 aspect ratio, the Max Vision HD+ display gives you the perfect viewing experience.

How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.name: Giulliana
reviews.body: Lo comore con ACHEMEX y me han dado excelenete servicio, les comente que el adaptador no funciono, y me enviaran un reemplazo. Buen equipo, para ser considerado gama media, es mas que excelente, a muy buen precio, se actualizo todo de inmediato, a penas unos dias, pero cero problemas, la verdad es que Xiaomi esta sacando buenos celulares y competitivos, hasta mejores que otros a mitad de precio, 100% recomendado.

reviews.name: ALBERT
reviews.body: El celular llegó perfecto y bien empacado, incluía el adaptador del cargador, por el precio en el q lo conseguí me paracion un muy buen celular, las cámaras funcionan muy bien y por el precio creo q son de las mejores nada extraordinario pero repito por el precio muy bien, contento con el celular

reviews.name: NAIRAM CAVALCANTI
reviews.body: O celular desde a primeira regarca apresentou aquecimento. Relataram ser normal um pouco e alteração de tomada da casa. Ao alterar houve realmente um problema na tomada da casa fazendo com que não fosse necessário a troca. Após dois meses de uso o celular apresentou quebra de voz na ligação só consigo ouvir e falar através do fone ou alto falante. Não teve queda e o aparelho não foi molhado em momento algum. Além de apresentar algumas outras observações na qual o torna ruim para mexer .... Tinha o Mi 8 ...e comparado a esse que é mais avançado... Prefiro o Mi 8

reviews.name: mumu
reviews.body: Llegó el 9 de mayo cuando la entrega estaba programada para el martes 12!! Muy rápida. Buen movil. Sabiendo lo que compras es un móvil de gama media de Xiaomi. La cámara es excelente. Aspecto exterior muy bonito y trae funda de silicona. El protector de pantalla es de plástico por lo que conviene cambiarlo por uno más adecuado. La pega es el embalaje. La caja de Xiaomi vino golpeada ostensiblemente en una esquina. Una pena porque esa es la primera impresión del producto. Por eso no le doy cinco estrellas.

reviews.name: miriam
reviews.body: Ho comprato questo telefono a fine giugno, dopo circa 4 mesi di utilizzo non eccessivo e senza 'incidenti' il telefono improvvisamente non si è più acceso. L'ho spedito all'assistenza Xiaomi, la quale mi presenta un preventivo di riparazione di quasi 180 € per ossidazione. Non avendo fatto cadere il telefono in acqua chiedo spiegazioni, mi rispondono che probabilmente il problema è dovuto all'umidità di cucina o bagno. Che dire? Non portate il telefono in bagno se avete intenzione di fare una doccia o in cucina se pensate di cucinare. Dimenticavo, la ditta mi ha proposto un coupon di ben € 30, da utilizzare sul loro sito. Secondo voi l'ho utilizzato?

reviews.name: catherine grange
reviews.body: j ai acheté un xiaomi en 9s et comme il plaisait a ma femme un autre en 9 pro, 400 euros d investissement pour deux beaux téléphones, mais au niveau réseau une catastrophe, est ce un model réellement européen ou un modelé asiatique, le problème est que l on ne capte rien, j ai aussi deux Samsung chez moi (un s9 et un note 9) et lors de test de débit avec xiaomi on atteint péniblement 5 mo et download là ou un Samsung en affiche plus de 40....et si on ne se met pas en wi fi chez moi les pages internet peinent a arriver, donc très déçu, ce n est malheureusement pas la première fois que je suis déçu par cette marque, vu les test j ai pense qu ils avaient amélioré les choses, mais grosse déception, du coup les deux repartent chez Amazon

reviews.name: Lo Recensiono
reviews.body: Modello intermedio della serie Redmi Note 9… Il Redmi Note 9s èun buon telefono, sicuramente migliorato rispetto al modello base, ma con una pecca, a parer mio, inaccettabile.. manca il modulo NFC! L’NFC è stato implementato su tutta la serie 9, tranne che su questo, seppur, le differenze tra i 3 modelli siano “irrisorie”, ci sono le differenze si notano, ma la maggiorate dell’utenza finale non lo nota. Troviamo l’impronta digitale sul lato destro, che seppur sia rapido, non sempre riesce riconoscere l’impronta, in video non mi è capitato. Gorilla Glass 5 su entrambi i lati… ma sul retro lascia le impronte porta Infrared e led delle notifiche in alto (utilissima) Ingresso jack e radio sul fondo Chipset di ultima generazione Snapdragon 720G ovviamente con tecnologia 64Bit Batteria da 5020 mah, che rende questo telefono inesauribile due slot per le schede e una per la memoria esterna Aggiornamento alla miui 12 reparto fotografico ottimo su carta. Posteriore: 48+8+5+2MP (principale f/1.79 + ultra-wide f/2.2 + macro + profondità) con singolo LED flash, PDAF e zoom digitale 10x Anteriore: 16MP Io ho avuto l’impressione, scattando le foto, che qualcosa risulti essere un po troppo Ovattato, ma comunque con un po di accortezza, si riescono a scattare belle foto, non possiamo avere tutto. Audio Buono seppur mono!

reviews.name: NAYANNA FERREIRA
reviews.title_review: Produto estragou com um mês de uso e vendedor não deu mais retorno.
reviews.body: Video Player is loading. Play Video Play Mute Current Time 0:00 / Duration -:- Loaded: 0% Stream Type LIVE Seek to live, currently playing liveLIVE Remaining Time -0:00 Playback Rate 1x Chapters Chapters Descriptions descriptions off, selected Captions captions off, selected Audio Track Fullscreen This is a modal window. The media could not be loaded, either because the server or network failed or because the format is not supported.  O produto chegou certinho e bem embalado, até cheguei a dar 5 estrelas. Porém, com apenas um mês de uso, eu estava vendo live no Youtube e de repente o aparelho travou, tentei sair da tela e não consegui, então o celular desligou e agora não liga mais. Entrei em contato com o vendedor e ele pediu para atualizar e resetar o aparelho, porém é impossível pois o mesmo nem liga. Dessa forma estou desde ontem de manhã mandando mensagens e e-mails para o vendedor incansavelmente e não obtenho mais respostas. Deixo aqui registrado minha indignação, pois preciso de uma aparelho novo, desse funcionando novamente ou do meu dinheiro de volta. Pois é um absurdo eu ficar no prejuízo desse valor. Espero que ele entre em contato antes de eu tomar medidas cabíveis.

reviews.name: William Dugan
reviews.title_review: Fast, a lot of storage, and ram, for a phone, at that price you can't beat it
reviews.body: I really like the speed of the phone, I hear it can be a problem with Verizon, have to have a Sim card already set up from other phone, I have a little problem getting a connection some times, not too often, maybe 4 or 5 time's in last 2-3 months, just had to restart the phone. Didn't talk to anyone about it yet, if it gets to be a big problem I'll call customer service, either at vendor or Verizon, manufacturer

reviews.name: TBAY
reviews.body: Ok. If you're looking for a phone on your budget I'd recommend this. This is better than samsung flagship, the ones that are international and run exynos chip. The 90hz display gives it a smooth transition along with it's snapdragon 855 chip that outperforms all phones in 2019 and some phones in 2020. This does not come along with the warp charger. What I got was the phone itself, with no scratches and excellent quality.

reviews.name: outlawzur
reviews.body: be very careful if you trying to get this item, as the phone comes with an app that will not be deleted and will not allow you to update your phone to the most recent android, you will be stuck with android 9, this I was told by the IT department of oneplus, this phones were made for the T-mobile store, and not for the public, so please be very careful.

reviews.name: Msd
reviews.body: Over all this phone is absolutely the most buttery and smooth phone I've ever used the only problem is it's 4g and deserves a real price drop for that. Beware when buying from Amazon that your product may be problematic but the easy return makes it worth buying in the first place. I returned the first one I got for an almost perfect condition one.

reviews.name: David Shayne Mckinney
reviews.body: Great deal on an awesome phone. Did not disappoint.

reviews.name: Belize
reviews.body: Please don't buy this model. It turn off but battery is not drained. Tech told me it's a defective model. Although, I got my refund except I live in Belize so I used shipping company and of course they won't refund my shhiping and duties so I wasted money for buying this model. It's not fixable so don't waste your money on this model.

reviews.name: Steven Gray
reviews.title_review: Phone came fast, in mint condition. Just hoping the internals reflect the beautiful exterior.
reviews.body: Phone came very quick. I had a Galaxy Note 10 and dropped it one time and it stopped working. So I was in the market for something very similar in specs with a better battery and so far I am extremely happy with my decision. I wanted the OnePlus 7pro when it came out but the $600 price tag kept me from purchasing. If you want a great phone that is basically a flagship phone, with a good camera and a beautiful notch less display, you can't go wrong with this phone.

reviews.name: Afu Langi
reviews.body: I've had this phone for a week and it's an amazing phone with all the features that it advertised, but after the software update, the front camera can't zoom in no more, the Bluetooth connectivity can't connect, the volume button only works for the phone setting on most apps that has movies and music and videos when it should be in media settings so you have go in and manually look for media volume, so this phone really is a let down for me, if they can have a software update for this phone to fix these I will give five but it doesn't do what I want it to do, and I've had OnePlus phones for years now

reviews.name: jesse
reviews.body: Phone was shipped and received very quickly. Supposed to be in Amazon renewed condition but the device I received was definitely not. The top speaker is boogered up with dirt, the entire chassis is scuffed up leaving a very dulled light grey on a black device..the only reason I didn't send it back is because I couldn't wait for another device. It's like everything about the device was mistreated, so they slapped a new screen on the device and promised renewed and sold for more than eBay was seeking them for. I may decide to send it back I'm just waiting on a burner to arrive.

reviews.name: iamalive
reviews.body: this phone is absolutely the best. great cameras and no hole punch or notch. they don't make em like this anymore. the back glass does tend to shatter, nothing you can do. but mine is covered in a carbon fiber sticker and a rhinoshield bumper case

reviews.name: LaAsha
reviews.title_review: Great price perfect condition no accessories
reviews.body: The amazon renew program is 100% worth it the phone looks brand new I can not find a single thing wrong with it. I will be using this program for all my electronics moving forward. I relied heavily on the other reviews when making my purchase everything everyone said was accurate. GREAT phone and I did purchase my own accessories as the phone doesnt come with any as other reviews have said. I was cool with no assesories because the price was so good.

reviews.name: Jared
reviews.title_review: False Advertising, received LOCKED phone when purchasing UNLOCKED phone
reviews.body: Did not receive the goods as listed on the product listing, I was sent a locked phone. Now, instead of using my phone immediately, I have to wait 2 weeks after submitting an application to T-Mobile so that I can unlock the phone myself. I would not have purchased this phone if I knew that I would have to do that. I am not impressed whatsoever.

reviews.name: CJ
reviews.body: Great phone, I was worried it wouldn't be unlocked or something but it can in in what looks like brand new condition, it did come with generic accessories though. The phone itself Is fast, sleek and really clean looking, oxygen is is also sooooo nice, easily my favorite software skin.

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.body: Thebcellhpone works with ecuadorian networks so that it's awesome, the phone is in pristine condition, it came with the wrong charger it is not an USB c but a mini.

reviews.name: ssosix
reviews.title_review: Curved screen looks nice but not vary practical
reviews.body: Not really liking this curved screen. It does look nice, but sometimes like if you have an x to close a window or the like button is on the edge it doesn't always work.

reviews.name: Momo
reviews.body: Never buy from this seller. It could be an honest mistake but I will assume the worse until rectified. The advertised product stated a 256 GB and 8Gb ram. Per the attached picture, that is false. Be careful buying from this seller.

reviews.name: TruthMaster
reviews.title_review: Good but the included charger is slow, not Warp as advertised in product description.
reviews.body: Very nice phone. Missing warp charger, I had to buy one separately. Included charger is very slow, not even Dash speed.

reviews.name: Zachary
reviews.body: Works great and showed up in perfect condition. The only problem was that it did not come with the warp charger.

reviews.name: Corey Jones
reviews.body: This works just like new. As long as that doesn't change, this is the best phone on the market. Beautiful screen and excellent features. An okay camera given the price point. I couldn't ask for more.

reviews.title_review: Excellent value even without the original accessories
reviews.body: Phone came in prestine condition. Basically new with sticker still attached. Was a good deal. Would definitely recommend.

title_item: Samsung Galaxy A21s A217M 64GB Dual SIM GSM Unlocked Android Smartphone (International Variant/US Compatible LTE) - Blue
description: Immerse yourself in the large 6.5 inch Infinity-O Display of Galaxy A21s. A wide aspect ratio fills your screen with content from edge to edge. Watch your favorite videos, games and live streams on its HD+ display. Galaxy A21s has a glossy and holographic finish that catches the eye. The smooth curves of the body allow for an easy and secure grip when navigating the screen. Go ultra high-res with a 48MP Main Cam for crisp, clear photos day and night. A 123° 8MP Ultra Wide Cam captures more of the view. Choose the upgraded 2MP Macro Cam for highly refined close-ups, and make sure the subject always stands out with the 2MP Depth Camera’s multiple Live Focus effects. Capture the wider world with the Ultra Wide Camera's wider field of vision. And with the 48MP Main Camera, your story stays bright and clear throughout the day. Quad Cam’s built-in 2MP Macro Cam (40mm) shoots with clarity and quality helping you bring out the ultra-fine details of your close-up shots. Apply natural background blur to isolate your subject and make it stand out. The 2MP Depth Camera lets you adjust the depth of field before and after you nail the shot. It reduces unwanted background noise from your images to make them look more professional. You want your selfie to look good. So for stunning daytime looks, Galaxy A21s' 13MP front camera gives you clear, high-resolution photos. And with Live focus to gently blur the background, your face becomes the star. When out living life, you need a phone that can last. A 5,000mAh battery gives you the power to stream, share and game on. And if you start running low, plug in and power up with up to 15W of fast charging. Built into the phone's hardware and software from the start, Samsung Knox protects your phone from the minute it's turned on. Offering multi-layered security, it defends your most sensitive information from malware and malicious threats. Enjoy peace of mind when you choose to buy a galaxy smartphone

reviews.name: Jo the geek
reviews.title_review: The best. It makes my eyes less tired. The best.
reviews.body: I bought this 3 days ago. It was at first awkward. Now it is the best phone I have ever had. It is a good narrow phone stick when folded. When spread it is a good tablet with relly good screen. Sturdy. Well made. Amazing quality.

reviews.name: Homer
reviews.title_review: Best Phone Ever. Versatile and great function.
reviews.body: I have had this phone for over three months. Here is my opinion. This is the best phoe I have had. I have not regretted the decision to buy this phone for a second. I have been a fan of the larger phones for years. I have gone throught the Note 7-10 phones and felt the large screen and form was perfect. I have always like using the S pen for editing as finger touch on a phone screen is not always perfect. I was worried that I might miss the S pen factor and the benefits of the Note series phones from Samsung. Plus, a folding phone was a new form and the earlier Samsung fold has some hinge issues. First, the fold factor is flawless. There is a clear and distinct opening and closing hinge. There is no doubt when the screen is fully closed or opened. And, the hinge is sturdy. No concerns about over stressing the joint. When closed, the front screen is more than adequate for answering or taking a quick look at messages/emails. It also is great for a quick look at a news feed. The folded size is a benefit in putting it in a narrow cell phone pocket or pants pocket. I find the folded ocnfiguraiton much easier to handle when carrying the phone or making a call. After looking at the front screen, opening the phone gives a near tablet size experience. The phone will allow you to read an app on the smaller front screen, and when opened, show the same information in a full expanded view. It does allow rotation and the screen fills with whatever is being viewed. Movies like Netflix allow a wide screen format or a fully expanded view. When sending messages, folding the phone to 90 degrees allows a large keyboard on the bottom hald and the messages or email on the top half. That's great for reviewing and sending information. Regarding the screens... The front screen has a protector that is different than the inside screen. I did remove the protector as it is exposed to daily use and does show some wear. There are multiple screen protectors on the market. It is an easy replacement. The inner screen has a softer and more rubbery feel. It doesn't bother me. I do need to clean it or wipe it off when it looks smudged. I have not had to replace it and it has stood up to three months of daily use. Being hidden inside the phone except when used keeps it from excessive wear. I do note that many people have replaced the inner protector without issues. Charging the battery gives me more than enough for daily moderate use. I have never had less than 20% at the end of the day. And, I keep my screen bright. I do not have background apps running all the time. My only gripe is that the phone are the case protectores. The phone when folded is thick. It is not so thick as to be a problem in a pocket or coat. However, all of the cases are thick and add more bulk than I want. My current solution is to only use a back case protector. The front and sides are uncovered. This has resulted in a small cosmetic ding on the hinge. But, even with an occaional drop, the found has worked without a problem. I can enthusiastically say that if you are considering this phone, you will not regret the purchase. The new form is fantastic. When folded, easy to answer and scan information. When opened, a tablet like experience. The best Samsung ever.

reviews.name: Wade
reviews.body: Bluetooth - If you require regular use of bluetooth connectivity, Do Not Buy This Phone!!. The connectivity is so poor that I cannot be more than three or four feet away from it. Absolutely unacceptable for a phone in this price range. Finger Print Reader - Finger print reader only works about one out of ten attempts. It's both easier and faster to type in a security code. Delamination - The laminated screen protector on the inside, large screen is continuously trying to delaminate. I have to continually try to work massive bubbles out from beneath the center, folding portion of the screen protector - ridiculous. Such a huge disappointment.

reviews.name: JPBLJJ
reviews.body: Worth every penny

reviews.name: BCH
reviews.title_review: Expensive and Woefully Inferior to an Apple/iOS Device
reviews.body: In a nutshell, if you are am iOS user and you have serious tasks to accomplish, never transition to a device running Android operating system. It's Android and not iOS. iOS still has the best ecosystem of all Operating Systems: PC, tablet, or phone. Luckily for me I can still still fall back to my iPhone 12 Pro Max. Yes, I have these 2 top of the line phones, courtesy of my job. I don't have to suffer using a Samsung phone. The Galaxy ZFold 2 5G at that. Samsung made a great phone with some inferior hardware in it: First: The fingerprint sensor just makes too many misreads. This is clearly inferior to Apple's Touch ID. The obnoxious iPhone 6S Touch ID was even better than the Galaxy ZFold2's fingerprint sensor. Second: NFC reader in this $2,000 Galaxy ZFold 2 is unbelievably unreliable. I could hold up a queue at the store trying to make this junk work. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. This issue is something I have never ever encountered in iPhone XS Max, iPhone 11 Pro Max, and my current iPhone 12 Pro Max. Third: Face recognition in the Galaxy Z Fold2 is nowhere close to an iPhone's face recognition. The Galaxy Z Fold2's facial recognition is slow and not nearly as reliable in recognizing faces. Fourth: Unlike an Apple device that pays attention to network quality, this phone will preferentially connect to 5G over 4G, regardless if 5G is not reliable. I'm not talking about Verizon's 5G UWB, which is technically the only real 5G in existence in few spotty places in a some cities. I'm talking about just Verizon's so called 'Nationwide 5G', which is 4G LTE made faster with more capacity to handle data traffic, but nowhere close to the real 5G. Unfortunately pseudo-5G from any carrier is not yet consistently reliable at this time. Sometimes 4G LTE will provides better user experience over unreliable pseudo-5G. So this Galaxy Z Fold2 preferentially connects to pseudo-5G when available even if signal is weak, but keeps buffering when streaming HD music. While an iPhone 12 Pro Max next to it preferentially connects to the network with the best conditions, is connected to 4G LTE instead of pseudo-5G, but streaming the same HD music flawlessly. Many other countless deficits of the Galaxy Z Fold2 5G is software side. It is an amazing piece of equipment, but largely limited by the software it runs and running its hardware. For a $2,000 phone, it's reduced to nothing more than a less expensive phone with a smaller screen. You go for it, if a large screen is for you. I loved the large screen, but it was quickly extinguished by the fact that Android versions of the same iOS apps will never work as flawlessly as their iOS counterparts. This is a huge lesson that hit me like being run over by a tank. I have never used Android since several versions ago. I first used an Android phone when Samsung released the Galaxy Note 2. That was nearly a decade or so ago. Android came a long way since then. It still remains woefully inferior to Apple's iOS. Android remains years behind iOS. The Bluetooth connectivity in an Android device remains painfully unreliable compared to an iOS device. I depend on certain apps to do my job and essentially get things done so I earn a living. The Android versions of the apps I use in business just simply don't work. Maybe because of the screens of the Galaxy Z Fold2, one being skinny while the other being twice the size, I could not be authenticated because the lower portion of the on-screen keyboard is cut off and won't re-size to fit either screen. Or the apps won't log-in 95% of the time, works decently 5% of the time. Some of my colleagues are switching to iPhones because the iPhone versions of the apps we use work flawlessly all the time. I played with the Disney+ app in this phone. It was a disaster. I downloaded 20Gb worth of movies into the device before my flight supposedly for offline watching. I started watching my downloaded movies while the plane was still on the ground. As the plane ascended and I lost internet connection, obviously. The app quit playing my downloaded movies because I'm no longer connected to the internet. The app literally signed me out and wants me to log back in, 30,000 ft up in the air. I scrambled to connect to the plane's Wi-Fi, logged in and carried on. While I had to switch from the Disney+ app to a browser to connect to plane's Wi-Fi, my Bose earbud lost connection to the phone. I had to reboot the Galaxy Z Fold2 to make everything work again. Sounds complicated and cumbersome, but yes I had to go trough all that crap to make it work. I thought that was a fluke and a one-off occurrence. On my flight back home, the same thing happened, except this time around some of my downloaded movies for "offline" watching won't play at all. This is just something I have never experienced in an Apple device with a similar setup, performing a similar task. Not ever! Even the native visual voicemail app in this Galaxy Z Fold2 5G does not work with Verizon or AT&T, either standard (free) visual voicemail or paid premium visual voicemail service. The carrier's respective high level tech support people cannot make it work. And so can't Samsung's tech support either. However, a third party provider, YouMail will work. Still not as good as an iPhone's standard visual voicemail. I am used to the flawlessness and reliability of the iPhone and its apps that I am retiring this Galaxy Z Fold2 5G just after 2 months of use. I can't even use it as a home office phone for the lack of working visual voicemail. I will never know if someone left me a voicemail. No indicator icon whatsoever.i have to manually call the voicemail number. I can't use it to control home automation systems either: the Android Savant app does not work as good as the Savant iOS version. It keeps disconnecting from he host and the reconnecting part is 90% done manually. Well, for perspective, Apple runs the guts of Savant Pro systems. So obviously it is naturally optimized for Apple. For the good side of this phone: it's an engineering marvel on its own right. The camera, while not as good as other Samsung models, is still quite decent. Unless you are someone who derives great satisfaction in awesome photos or who makes a living out of its cameras, then grab another model. The cameras in a Samsung phone is one thing that I will give a two-thumbs-up over an iPhone's of any generation. I'm still not that pleased with my iPhone 12 Pro Max's camera. Overall, this Galaxy Z Fold2 is not for me. It's expensive for the limited functions and a degraded user experience it provides. It's got tons of potential that are mostly extinguished by the fact that is running a less-than-perfect Operating System and suite of software to complement it. Just like any hardware, if the software running it is crappy, you could have the best hardware in the world in your hands, but has lackluster performance. This is exactly the Galaxy Z Fold2 to me. If you do serious tasks, particularly for business, this is not the right tool. Taking photos, viewing them, reading eBooks, making basic calls, texting, browsing the web - this thing can do well - assuming you don't rely on Samsung Pass to assist you with your logins. If you do, you're better off using something else. Samsung Pass is quite dumb, redundant, and cannot remember certain sites. Again the iPhone's Passwords is still way more reliable than Samsung Pass.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.body: I wanted to love this thing, but quite frankly it's not worth the hefty price. I switched to samsung from iphone some 10 years ago because I loved the phablet experience from the early Notes (Note3 as a matter of fact). I actually don't like the new notes compared to the old ones. The feel in your hand and the size with a stylus were amazing. I digress.... this is about the Z fold 2. I just couldn't pass up the pull to buy the latest gadget. Unfortunately, it's just not "there" yet. I think it needs to be double the size of the note20 when you open it. So in my mind it is still not big enough. The front screen is still too small to really use..... the inside screen is just simply Meh.....and the abilty to effectively use the wider screen really isn't "there yet" (programs/apps lagging). When I say the inside screen is Meh, I mean that it has a horrible "feel" to it and even with me being excessively protective and careful with it, it already has a small ding in it. From what I have no idea as i baby this thing. And I am not a young kid that abuses their devices (I'm 50 and take excellent care of this thing). I am going on 6 months of owning this phone and I still do not think the price is justified. I won't be a sucker an buy the next iteration that comes out. Not for this price.

reviews.name: John
reviews.body: Phone answering problem: once "do not disturb" is on, and someone calls OUTSIDE of "do not disturb" hours, phone vibrate, but does not let you answer. Screen also goes black and cannot hangup. OS: I am coming from IOS, this device is not intuitive. sending photo, saving a phone number (after typing in, bottom menu disappears.), attaching file and emailing, etc.... Everything is very different but overall you will have to take more unintuitive and longer steps to complete. After using this phone, i realize how well IOS is designed. how thoughtfully anticipates the user's next steps and brings up menu function right where is needed. Very unhappy with both hardware and software So stay away. you can get iphone 12 pro for about half of the price. and iphone 12 pro is much much better phone. (we have iphone 12 pro in our family).

reviews.name: Jennifer L.
reviews.body: I bought mine through Verizon but I wanted to share what a great phone this is. Battery life is incredible. I can go all day with a single charge. I love the choice of 2 screens. I am still working with the camera. It's great, but I came from a Galaxy 7 Edge that died on me, but I loved the camera on it. DEFINITELY buy screen and camera protectors along with a sturdy case. This thing is a little heavy but I'm loving it.

reviews.name: ckdontes
reviews.body: This is a great phone and I've had no issues that all these Apple fan boys are having. Yes if you notice, most of the negative reviews are from iphone users. Seems to me like these people already had a negative outlook on any Android device. If you're hesitant about leaving Apple for Android then don't do it. I bet half of these Apple reviewers have never laid hands on this phone. I've owned iphones for years as well as Android. No Fanboy here. I've had the Fold 2 since launch with no issues. It's a solid device and not as fragile as so many non-owners make it out to be.

reviews.name: lildbcakes
reviews.body: The one star is simply because this phone did not work on Verizon despite the description saying that it is "compatible with most major U.S. GSM and CDMA Networks." I spent 1.5 hrs chatting with Verizon and could not get the phone to work despite saying that it was on their network. I returned that phone for a replacement and the 2nd phone also would not make or receive calls.

reviews.name: Michael J.
reviews.title_review: Phone is outstanding, unless you use ATT
reviews.body: No complaints about the phone, but for some reason, ATT will not recognize it. After three days and five visits to various ATT service centers, I am returning it. Also, there is no help from the Amazon support folks. In fact, both sides directed me to the other for the solution. Not sure about the other carriers.

reviews.name: D. Sourile
reviews.title_review: It's a midrange phone. You must accept that. It's not a flagship killer.
reviews.body: Look, this phone is amazing on paper and will get tons of love because it's a huge screen at a low price. But it's the little things that add up to a bad experience. I returned mine and went back to a flagship model. Here's why: -No IP68 water resistance. Suddenly, I was afraid to take pictures of my kids while they played in the water. No answering emails near a pool or in the bath. I missed that. -Camera is bad. Slow shutter, subpar quality, could not capture motion well (kids). -Bad radios. Had dropped calls for the first time in YEARS. Unreal. Internet connection was worse. Bluetooth was cutting in and out. Really surprised. -Plastic cheap looking back. Nah. -Stuttered when pushed. I guess I'm spoiled by top tier processors and RAM amounts. -No dual speakers. Makes a huge difference in sound. -No wireless charging. I miss that. -No reverse wireless charging. I miss that too. -Less RAM so apps reload sooner. I appreciated the fact that it had expandable storage. Honestly, it does everything fine for the average consumer. But not for someone used to flagship phones. The camera is too important to me, among other details it whiffs on.

reviews.name: Melissa
reviews.body: I don't write many reviews, but since this phone is new to the US market, I thought I would throw my two cents in. I have only had two smartphones since 2016, yep I was a big hold out, and they were both cheap BLU phones, so I don't have much to compare this to. It's more phone than I need, and it's a great phone so far, except for one thing. It has no LED notification light. I didn't know this when I bought it, and I'm struggling. The reason I decided to replace my year and a half old phone is that the notification light constantly flashed for no known reason. I always have sound off, and I'm not always right near my phone, so it's annoying thinking I missed a call or text and checking my phone, I realize it's just a glitch. This phone doesn't tell me I missed a call or message unless I check it. I think that's better, but only slightly. Some people will not be bothered by this, but I only realized this after I bought it, even after reading many reviews. The fingerprint sensor is ok, fails sometimes, and I have no screen protector, but it might fail more often with one. You can use the PIN option as well. It takes pretty good pictures, but again, I can only compare with not so great phones. I thought I would be wowed by this phone after reading all the reviews and coming from a true budget phone, but I'm just on the fence. So essentially my two cents is do a lot of research and make sure this, or any phone, has the features you want, because while this phone is new to the US market and is getting rave reviews, there might be a better phone out there even cheaper.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title_review: Works with Sprint but not Verizon (CDMA)
reviews.body: Despite the band compatibility, it doesn't work with Verizon at the moment.

reviews.name: Mekonnen Akellom
reviews.body: I had receieved my A50 Samsung Galaxy three days ago & everything just working fine. I have LTE connectivity with AT&T and running super fast. For US resident buyers, i do recommend this is the perfect model to buy. A50 is pretty much comparable to a flagship at the lowest price. The pictures are top notch. Buy the right model, i bet you will not regret.

reviews.name: AD
reviews.body: There are two things to a smartphone experience: a) the phone feature- mic, speaker, and associated experience, and b) the smartphone experience. I will be succinct in my feedback. The phone failed miserably on its phone experience- speaker quality is sub-par, on smartphone side, its average-screen is good (not great), camera is sub-par, screen touch is slow and freezes. Only good feature is that the battery lasts well over a day.

reviews.name: Chicagoan In Exile
reviews.title_review: A mixed bag: great display, capable processor but disappointing battery life and connectivity
reviews.body: I wanted to buy an unlocked, reasonably priced, sort of future proof phone because I'm not totally satisfied with my current carrier (Boost Mobile) and I am tired of "collecting" carrier-locked phones in a drawer when I switch to a new provider and have to purchase a new device. I was almost set on purchasing a Galaxy A51 when the A71 5G showed up on Amazon. It looked like a huge step up from my old phone (Galaxy A20) as well as the A51. I wasn't necessarily looking for 5G because it's still in its infancy, but things like the Snapdragon 765G processor, 128GB of storage and 6GB RAM were appealing, not to mention the 6.7-inch full HD+ Super AMOLED display. After briefly being distracted by the Galaxy S10 Lite (same price, faster processor, but no headphone jack), I popped for the A71 5G. So far, I'm not sure I made the right choice; here's why: 1.) My old A20 had a 4000 mAh battery that frankly was disappointing. It came up short when compared to my previous phone, an LG XCharge that was nothing special except for the 4500 mAh battery that had unreal longevity (in fact, I recently turned it on after it has sat in a drawer for almost four months and it had 65% charge left). Most days, I had to charge the A20 every night. I bring this up because just yesterday I had to recharge my new A71 5G TWICE in one day. 2.) There are a few barriers in the smallish house where I live that challenge the wifi router. The A20 would disconnect sometimes; the A71 5G disconnects much more frequently. Some apps seem more susceptible to disconnection than others, which made me wonder if the issue was the apps rather than the connection. With the A20, I'm pretty sure the apps were the problem; I'm not so sure with the A71 5G. I have seen other reviews here and elsewhere that reference disconnection issues with this phone. Hmm... 3.) The step up to full HD from the A20's 720p was a bigger improvement than I expected, so this is a plus for the new phone. However, the audio is just a lateral move; neither is that great. While this isn't a deal breaker per se, the new LG Velvet as well as the new Galaxy S20 Fe both have stereo speakers; while the S20 FE is $100 more (as I write this), the LG is the same price and has twice the storage (256GB vs 128GB). Honestly if there were an unlocked version of the LG Velvet available today, I'd take a serious look at it. Overall, the pluses of my A71 5G don't quite outweigh the minuses. With the S10 Lite still being available at the same price (albeit sans headphone jack) and the new S20 FE being just $100 more, if the connection issues can't be resolved with this A71 5G, I may be making a change.

reviews.name: David Abel
reviews.title_review: Samsung Galaxy A51 Unlocked (US Version) with earbuds.
reviews.body: (Straight Talk) I just bought me and my wife one of these phones each and we are very happy with them Upgraded from an S7 and an iPhone 6s through Straight Talk. Copied all info over, with smart switch (app) and swapped the active Straight Talk sim cards from our current phones to the new phones (No sim card included in this phone) and they work perfectly. Phones also arrived a week before they were due, which was great. The ear buds are very nice also. However I must note that there were separate charges for the phone and ear buds, it was equal to the total listed price tho.

reviews.body: Up grade from a Huawei Honor 5 went back to Samsung this time and I am glad I did. Set up was easy enough sept for the sim chip from my old phone was to big so I had to make a short trip to the local ATT store for assistance. All the rest of the set up was basically handle by Google. Still learning the differences, but am really place with this purchase. reviews.name: mark rogde
reviews.title_review: Problem with a Samsung phone A50 !!
reviews.body: We bought this phone for our daughter with a disability because Samsung has been so easy for her to use. After 5 months we started having problems with the phone not charging right at different times. We reached out to Amazon for help. Only to be told they have heard Samsung has had a lot of problems with the Samsung A50 phones. Amazon sent a email to Samsung to see if there was something that could still be done about the phone. Never heard anything. Sadly one day we plugged it in to see if we could get it charged and it got really hot started smoking a little now it won’t do anything. I guess she will have to save up to buy another phone. Sadly we won’t be going with Samsung afraid to take a chance of this happening again to her. This was a big set back for her. I just don’t want this to happen to someone else.😥

reviews.name: NASA Technology Man
reviews.title_review: Feature Rich Unlocked Device for a Really good price.
reviews.body: First let's Begin with the Bad. Wi-Fi Calling will ONLY Work on T-Mobile/Sprint Services. AT&T and Verizon DON'T Support SIM Card Based Wi-Fi Calling. Now the Good. This Device DOES Support Low and Mid Band 5G and Possibly High Band mmw 5g. The Camera is AWESOME, and the NFC for Google and Samsung Pay is Really Sensitive. Battery life is pretty good Depending on your Signal. If your signal is low a lot expect to have high battery drain. I have used this Samsung A71 5G on T-Mobile and AT&T and the 5G works Great. FYI, this Samsung A71 5G WON'T WORK with C-Spire Wireless as they DON'T Presently Allow this UNLOCKED Smartphone on their System. However they might in the Near Future. Both T-Mobile Low and Mid Band 5G work Flawlessly and AT&T's 5G DSS (Dynamic Spectrum Sharing is Great too, However AT&T Doesn't Offer Dedicated 5G Bandwidth so Expect Slower 5G Speeds with AT&T vs T-Mobile since T-Mobile has Dedicated 5G Bandwidth. Overall the Phone works Perfect and for the Price it's Hard to Beat. The Next Best Samsung as far as Price and Features go would be the Samsung A51 5G.

reviews.name: Jennifer Lanam
reviews.body: before this phone, I had a Motorola G6 that just worked okay until the Android pie 9 update. After that, it was slow and work like crap. So I decided to go back to Samsung and finally be able to schedule my text messages to send when I wanted them to again. This phone is quick and works well. The fingerprint sensor works okay on WiFi and hardly at all when I'm out of the house and taking data, so I switched to face recognition. It with very well and asked for a shot of me with glasses. But with a mask?? 😷 Probably not a good idea, so I sweetie my pattern when I'm wearing one. I do wish the newer phones wouldn't go with the very slim and long design, because the width of the phone is really the real estate that I'm looking for, but that's all the newer phones, I guess. (Small-handed people complaining about their phones being too hard to hold?) I'm very happy with this phone. Just a heads up: if you're planning to use an unlocked phone with Tracfone on Verizon, everything works great except Visual Voicemail. They still can't get that running, and I've pretty much given up on it. Any tips?

reviews.name: Anonomous
reviews.body: I had this phone for 3 weeks when it started acting up. I contacted Tracfone and over the next 2 weeks we tried to get the phone to work properly. Long story short, it will not do anything now. Won't turn off, won't call, won't accept calls. Tracfone told me over a week ago that it was sending me a new phone. Called AGAIN yesterday and they told me that a return box was on the way to me and would be here by last night. The tracking number they gave me is not recognized by any carried. No box arrived. I was told that they would have to have the phone back in their possession before they send me a new one. Of course, the return to Amazon is no longer possible. I feel that Tracfone is playing me. They have my $250 for the phone and are not interested in customer service. I have used Samsung for years and I guess I just got a lemon. In the meantime, I am out a lot of money and have nothing to show for it. BEWARE OF NO CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM TRACFONE1

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title_review: Samsung A71 5G Unlocked does not work on Verizon Network.
reviews.body: The New Unlocked A71 5G phone I bought will not connect to a Verizon 5G network. Samsung provides no support for a phone bought on Amazon but the seller(AMAZON) refers you to them for support. Amazon refuses to discount the phone or replace the phone with one that will work on a Verizon 5G network. I was offered a $10.00 credit. The only other options are to just keep the phone or return it. The last member of customer service I spoke to, Alex, was condescending apparently he knows more about Samsung phones than the sales people at the Verizon Corporate stores or their on line tech support.

reviews.name: Joon Choi
reviews.title_review: DOES NOT WORK WITH VERIZON PREPAID - READ PLEASE
reviews.body: So i got this phone because we ported from ATT to verizon prepaid. Everything on the port over side went smooth but the phone would not make or receive calls. It was very weird because verizon thought it was the sim so we replaced the sim and we tried a temp number because verizon thought it might be the port over having issues but in the end it was the phone. for some reason my post paid business account verizon sim card would work on the phone. it was very odd. i was able to send and receive calls, internet worked, texts/mms all worked on my post paid sim but on the prepaid sim it would not work. we did manage to get it to work ONCE when i switched the sim from an iphone 8 to the A50, verizon thought that the phone was an iphone 8 so it let the sim work but once the system recognized the imei of the samsung a50, it would deactivate the HD voice calling as per verizon, which will stop all voice or voLTE services. so it's a verizon(prepaid) issue not knowing what the phone is. if the phone is recognized by the system it will work. the phone is CAPABLE of being used on the cdma network (because it works when you switch the sim from an iphone make a call and then switch it back to the phone you should be able to either make or receive 1 call) but because VERIZON prepaid doesn't recognize the phone or what kind of phone it is, it does not work. so shame on your verizon(prepaid) for basically not letting a unlocked cdma phone to work on your network. anyway it's a good phone, it's not s class fast but it has almost all the features you would need. For any other major carrier, i do suggest this phone, but if you are going verizon (prepaid, only tested for about 20 mins on my post paid business account), i would say don't even try because you will run into headaches.

reviews.name: normal guy
reviews.title_review: A71 is a lousy phone. Feels pretty good in the hand but otherwise it's infuriating to use.
reviews.body: This Samsung A71 is a lousy phone. It feels pretty good in the hand but otherwise it's mostly infuriating to use. So many topics to complain about but I'll try to limit it to 3 so I can get on with my life. 1. The Bluetooth worked ok at the start but within a few months it went to suck. Constantly dropping out for several seconds of silence and then picking back up - no matter which headphones I am using or how close I am to phone. Switching BT on and off, restarting entire phone, fiddling with settings for ages all no help. Now must return. 2. Bixby personal assistant feature is intrusive and annoying AF and you can't turn it off 3. Keyboard layout and poor spell check routine makes texting painful. Tiny space key next to huge period key and little go button. WTH? Could go on but that's enough. All my other phones both those less and more expensive and both androids from other companies and apple models have been better and less annoying. It seems solid from a physical standpoint though.

reviews.name: Nabil Esphahani
reviews.title_review: Carriers that this Phone will work with their 5G Network
reviews.body: Phone supports for 5G: n2, n5, n66 Phone supports for mmWave n260, n261 Disclaimer: This may contain errors and most importantly cannot be without further data from providers foretell what you experience is (e.g., the listed waves per carrier some are deployed in some states and other not in other states - nothing about a wave being necessarily nationwide). 1- AT&T supports n269 for mmWave and n5 for 5G - so just 5G with this phone 2- Verizon supports n2, n5, n66 (not sure about n66) for 5G and n260 and n261 for mmWave (and n40 for midwave - Both 5G and mmWave (in some areas) 3- Sprint does not support any of the 5G or mmWave bands this phone supports. 4- T-Mobile supports n261 and n260 (mmWave in some areas). Speaking generally 5G is in its beginning for most carriers in most of the country so whatever phone you get you will be LTE most of the time for quite a while. Note: There may be errors and of course comparing any providers will have to be based on location and coverage. There may be no 5G coverage at where I live and the speeds vary widely. Or I may be lucky and great the promised 5G speeds but I am betting on LTE most of the time.

reviews.name: Jeff Berlin
reviews.title_review: THE Smartphone for creatives and content creators
reviews.body: The Xperia PRO is my second Sony phone and to me the best yet. I previously had an Xperia 1 II and one of my favorite things about that phone is the display, the screen, it’s amazing! So good that I stopped bringing my iPad on trips to watch movies. I did travel a bit during the pandemic and being able to watch films and TV on my phone, which is always with me, at the very highest quality was very spoiling. I also am a content creator - a cinematographer and photographer - so when I heard about the Xperia PRO, that it has the same screen that hooked me on the Xperia 1 II, but also has an HDMI input and can be used as an on-camera monitor, this I needed to see so I picked one up. Most of the monitors I use on shoots are heavier, thicker, use external batteries, and frankly, the display quality usually isn’t as good. So now I literally have a 5G phone that I can take out of my pocket, mount on my camera, and shoot with, referencing a display that offers HDR, 4K resolution, and even pinch to zoom. The Xperia PRO is robust and has very good battery life. Highly recommended for all but especially for content creators like videographers, cinematographers and photographers.

title_item: Nokia G50 5G | Android 11 | Unlocked Smartphone | US Version | 4/128GB | 6.82-Inch Screen | 48MP Triple Camera | Ocean Blue
description: Nokia G50 is a smartphone for today, ready for tomorrow. The Qualcomm Snapdragon 480 5G Mobile Platform means it’s 5G ready. It also comes with a 48MP triple camera, a battery that lasts for days, Nordic quality, and the latest Android 11, with 2 years of OS upgrades. This product will not support Verizon or Verizon subsidiaries. Please confirm compatibility with your chosen carrier before purchasing. For support with SIM card or network related issues, please contact your carrier for assistance in connecting your device to the chosen compatible network. Supported Network bands: 2G: 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 3G: 850 / 900 / 1700(AWS) / 1900 / 2100 4G/LTE: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 12, 13, 17, 20, 25, 26, 38, 40, 41, 66 5G/Sub6: 2, 5, 7, 38, 41, 66, 71, 78 Charging: This product is designed to be charged using the charging adapter and charging cable that are provided in the product box. Charging this device with any other charging adapter or cable may cause device malfunction. Please observe basic safety steps when charging this device and do not charge this product with malfunctioning or damaged equipment. Current Software Version: Android 10 Bluetooth Version/Range: 4.2 – 30’ Range FAQ How can I install available updates? In many cases updating your product to the latest software version will alleviate any issues experienced. To update your device please navigate to Settings > System > System update > Check for update to check if updates are available. Follow the on screen prompts to install the latest software version if available.= How can I close an app that has stopped working? Open Settings on your phone and select Apps. Then find the app you're having issues with and select Force Stop. I want to conserve battery life. How can I activate the Power Saver mode? On your phone, open Settings, then choose and activate Battery Power Saving. Please also be aware that battery life depends on a variety of factors such as device usage frequency, application requirements, your current operating system, and cellular signal strength. How can I back up my files? Navigate to Settings > System > Backup, and switch backup on. How can I reset my smartphone's network settings? Navigate to Settings > Network & Internet > more_vert > Reset. Performing this reset may help if you're having connection issues. How do I connect my phone to my carrier network? If your Nokia phone and network are compatible, place your SIM card in the SIM card tray using the included SIM card removal tool to open the SIM tray. Once your SIM card has been inserted into the device, power on your phone and proceed through the product setup steps. If you are not able to connect to your network after finalizing the product setup, please contact your carrier support for additional assistance as every carrier has different steps to assist you in ensuring your product connects to their compatible network. How can I ensure other people hear me on my microphone? If you are experiencing microphone issues with your device and your product has a Google Assistant button, please ensure that the Google Assistant button is not stuck or dirty as this will cause the microphone to not function as intended. If the Google Assistant button is not obstructed, please ensure that there is no dirt or debris in the headphone port of your product. If the headphone port is also clear, please disable the microphone permission of the Google Assistant, by going to Settings > Apps & Notifications > Google App > Permission > Microphone > Deny. How can I turn up the volume to my speaker? First, please ensure that there is no dirt or debris in the headphone port of your product. If your headphone port is clear, please make sure that “Do Not Disturb” is not enabled. To disable this setting, navigate to Settings > Do not disturb. Make sure this is toggled off. If Do Not Disturb is off, navigate to Settings > Sounds and vibration > Volume > move the Media slider to the right to increase volume and test your speaker. If you are still not able to hear any audio, check the settings of the application that you are using from the Settings menu as many applications will have their own volume settings. Why is my phone feeling warm, closing apps or occasionally slowing down? During extended operation, the device may feel warm. In most cases, this is normal. To avoid getting too warm, the device may automatically slow down, dim display during a video call, close apps, switch off charging, and if necessary, switch itself off. If the device is not working properly, take it to the nearest authorized service facility. How do I reboot my smartphone when it’s not responding? If your phone is unresponsive, you can perform a “soft reset” by pressing the volume up key and the power button simultaneously for about 15 seconds (or until phone vibrates). Your phone should then restart momentarily. This is a safe and quick way to reboot your device without losing or erasing any data. My phone won’t charge. What should I do? First ensure the issue isn't with the power source or socket you're using - you can quickly check this by plugging your phone into a different outlet, then checking if it charges. If the socket is not the issue, try taking a closer look at the power cable or charging port on your phone, ensuring everything appears as it should. Then, try turning your phone off completely and plugging it into the socket - bear in mind if the battery is completely drained, it might take up to 2 or 3 minutes to start charging. How can I contact support? Our customer support page offers a number of ways that you can contact support. Please visit the Nokia website for further assistance. How do I fix touch sensitivity issues on my phone? Before performing any additional troubleshooting steps, please ensure that your product does not show any physical damage, has not been exposed to water, the screen is clean, and your fingers and hands are not wet or dirty. Please also remove any 3rd party screen protectors that you may have on the device as non Nokia branded screen protectors may decrease the touch sensitivity of the device. If none of these solutions resolve the issue that you are facing, please perform a hard reset back to factory settings. Please note: a hard reset will completely erase all the data, settings and content on your smartphone, returning it to the original factory settings. We strongly advise that you back up your device before a hard reset. Visit here to learn more about how to back up your smartphone remotely. To reset your smartphone and erase all its content, first make sure your phone is connected to a power source. We also recommend that your battery is at least 50% charged when you perform a hard reset. Press the volume up key and the power button simultaneously for about 30 seconds or until the root menu appears. Then choose the action you want to take from the root menu, in this case “Wipe data/factory reset”. Alternatively, you can also perform a hard reset by tapping Settings > Backup & Reset > Factory data reset > Reset phone > Erase everything.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.body: I love this phone. I believe this was the first of the Convoys and is the heaviest and most rugged in my opinion. I purchased the Convoy model that followed, from Verizon, only because I accidentally ran over my first phone and the original was no longer available. The latter was much lighter and didn't handle being dropped as well. The back plate kept popping off. My husband still has his original Convoy with the original battery, model SCH-U640, that we purchased 11 years ago. 'still works great. If you don't need all of the bells and whistles of a smartphone this phone is worth keeping.

reviews.name: dogwood
reviews.title_review: I've used this model phone for a couple years now and I like the phones
reviews.body: Order two of these phones. I've used this model phone for a couple years now and I like the phones. Phones arrived within estimated delivery time or sooner and physically good condition as described. However, I have ordered used phones many times in the past and NEVER before did I get a used phone with PERSONAL INFORMATION from the prior owner still on the phone. Over 200 contacts, personal pictures, text messages, and call history. BOTH of these two phones had this. One of the phones is secured and I cannot remove the old contact data. I'm afraid to use use it because I don't want my backup assistant updating all those prior contacts leaving me with hours of time cleaning it up - provided the prior contacts can be cleaned off the phone. Based on this experience I would recommend caution when purchasing phones from this vendor.

reviews.name: Loren
reviews.title_review: Buy from "Quality Used Phones" for fast shipping!
reviews.body: I got this phone shipped to Hawaii. It shipped from South Carolina, and arrived in less than 3 days! The phone was $27 with $5 dollar shipping. More than 4500 miles in that short of time. The phone itself was better than I expected it to be. Came with phone, charger, and battery. Practical, tough, and great battery life. Nice, large buttons that light up. I switched from an iPhone. I use this phone for calling and text messaging, and use the iPhone for music, apps, and internet when connected to WiFi. I save $20 a month and have a more practical phone that can last a week without being charged. I suggest buying from "Quality Used Phones" if you want some fast shipping. You get exactly what it says you get. Would buy again!

reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.body: The phone was advertised as compatible with Verizon our carrier. It was NOT compatible. We took it to the Verizon store and they informed us that they couldn't do anything with it. They suggested a number to call in order to activate and that didn't work either. I e-mau=iled the seller and they didn't respond. although I waited a week. We returned the phone t Amazon today.

reviews.name: D. scott
reviews.body: Durable, well built flip phone with great reception and sound quality. I got this as a replacement for the flip phone my wife got from Verizon a year ago and it's a lot better. Also, I acivated it while talking to a verizon rep on the phone I about 5 minutes. Piece of cake!

reviews.title_review: Good as a replacement phone in a pinch
reviews.body: I bought this as a temporary replacement for a broken smart phone to use on Verizon's network with Pageplus cellular. It is just OK, not great. Pretty easy to use; relatively durable but not rugged as advertised. Be aware that it will only work for calling and texting on Pageplus. Any data function will not work. It does not get great reception, one less bar than my smart phone (Motorola) in most situations.

reviews.title_review: But its nice to know those bells and whistles are there if ...
reviews.body: I recently had a Convoy phone stolen and when i went looking for a replacement phone, I still chose the Convoy. Its simple, functional, and i have to admit, does more things than i'll ever use. But its nice to know those bells and whistles are there if i decide to use them in the future. Its not a "smart" phone, buts its the best flip phone ive ever owned.

reviews.title_review: it was funny that I received 2 phones like that
reviews.body: Let's just say you get what you pay for. I also run a small business for the past 20 yrs. I purchased a phone and upon receiving it I noticed the charging port cap was broken off. I believe this would allow dirt and moisture in. The phone also had all the personal family photos of the gentlemen who previously owned the phone still on it ! Well, I received a call from the owner of the company apologizing. He said that he would replace the phone for free and all I had to do was send back the 1st one. He stated he did not want to discipline any employees as he did not want to hurt their feelings , and that he was just trying to earn a buck. WHAT? I received the new phone , and noticed the back of the phone where the battery sits had dirt and sand in it. I received an email from him stating that ,it was funny that I received 2 phones like that. I offered to send photos of the phone to him. He said to keep both phones. My response to him was that I did not think he would be in business very long.

reviews.name: A. Minton
reviews.title_review: The Convoy Outsmarts the Smartest "Smart Phone"
reviews.body: I love this phone. I am on my third one, all purchased as used or refurbished. I've tried the smart phones, Android, iPhone, and I always come back to this. It truly is rugged and I am very hard on phones. The Convoy I use now was left out in the rain in a puddle for a week before I rescued it and, after an hour or two on the charger, it immediately powered up. If you want a phone that is resistant to being dropped on concrete or into a pan of hot dishwater (done both), you'll love the Convoy. Old-fashioned...yes...my kids make fun of me for carrying it, but I was getting tired of constantly buying new phones. I will continue to use the Samsung Convoy until I am forced to switch to a "smarter" cell phone with a pricey data plan (which I have no doubt will eventually happen) but the batteries for this cell phone are cheap and stay charged for a week. Show me a smart phone that can do that.

reviews.name: William C. Werner
